title: I Tested 10 Agricultural Technologies and Found the BEST for Taiwan Guavas!

tasks.task: Planting guava sprouts in the nursery.
subtasks: Select healthy guava sprouts.
Plant sprouts by hand, maintaining specific spacing.
Equip plants with drip irrigation system.
Install drip irrigation system with filtered water sources.
Apply pruning and shaping techniques after four months.
Remove grass competition around trees.
Prepare trees for fruiting by wrapping guavas and harvesting mature fruits.
Harvest guavas using scissors, inspecting sweetness.

tasks.task: Applying mechanical agriculture techniques for raising grapes.
subtasks: Dig holes for planting grape vines using mechanical tools.
Plant grape vines and provide stakes for support.
Install wire for vertical growth.
Use drip irrigation and fertilizers for optimal growth.
Handpick grape bunches for quality control.
Dry grapes under sun for three weeks.
Use machinery for faster harvesting.
Clean and process grapes through conveyor belts and vacuum technology.
Perform laser sorting for quality assurance.

tasks.task: Operating high-efficiency machinery for Brussels sprout and carrot harvesting.
subtasks: Use automated harvesters for Brussels sprouts and carrots.
Transport harvested crops to processing facilities.
Clean and sort sprouts and carrots using specialized machinery.
Maintain crop quality through teamwork and advanced equipment.
Operate a Klaas Jaguar forage harvester (Doggy Style).
Use FEN TO 516 Vario and ESA Lift Carrot Harvester for carrot processing.
Employ FENT 820 and 724 Vario for reliable transport and drying plant loading.
